Yeah, I was wondering how Frank's statement that these are rarely heard by=
 more than one person and only meant for the user, really supported the beh=
avior of this group of people posting their EVPs and asking for opinions.=
=C2=A0 But, if everyone agrees with Frank on that, we can keep the claim as=
 "The messages received are for the user, and rarely does anyone hear the s=
ame thing as the original listener."

=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      Ju=
st a guess, since I don't have a lot of experience with this - probably the=
 mesages are meant for one user and it's best if one user listens at a time=
.
=C2=A0
It could be that some=C2=A0messages come through that=C2=A0are mea=
nt for multiple users at once. I've heard the same things as Frank in some =
of the recordings he's posted. FWIW.
=C2=A0
Zack


On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 1=
2:51 PM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 







Thanks Zack.=C2=
=A0 So how do you see not asking it questions squaring with Frank's comment=
 of "It's not the device, it's the user. The messages received are for the =
user, and rarely does anyone hear the same thing as the original listener."=



Does that mean two people can't use it together?=C2=A0 How would they kn=
ow which the message was for if they do?=C2=A0 Or is it best to only use it=
 alone?


--- On Thu, 1/7/10, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:



F=
rom: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> 

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] What does i=
t do?

Date: Thursday, January 7, 2010, 10:40 A=
M 





=C2=A0 


I don't think any of us know really who or what the "enti=
ties" are. They have told a few people who they are, but given the propensi=
ty of some to lie, who knows?
=C2=A0
I also believe you do not need to ask =
any questions at all - just let the box run and listen to what comes out, m=
aybe record it at the same time so you can replay it later.
=C2=A0
Zack


O=
n Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 12:10 PM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 

=






Perhaps I am not being clear.=C2=A0 I am not asking how it works.=C2=
=A0 I am asking what you claim it does.

For example, from your statements =
below, I get:

"The Frank's box allows entities to use FM and AM radio broa=
dcast as raw material, which these enties select and shape to communicate w=
ith the user.=C2=A0 The messages received are for the user, and rarely does=
 anyone hear the same thing as the original listener."


Can you be any mor=
e specific as to what you mean by 'entities'?
Also, can the user be defined=
 as the person asking the box questions?




--- On Thu, 1/7/10, Frank Sump=
tion <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:



From: Frank Sumption <purpleali=
engirl@ gmail.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] What does it do? 

To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups .com
Date: Thursday, January 7, 2010, 9:35 AM 



=C2=A0 


=C2=
=A0It's a freaking radio!=C2=A0 The tuning is swept across the entire band,=
 AM or FM, the resulting bits of speech, music, and noise are used by the e=
nitites as a raw material to build their voices from. The sweep can be line=
ar, random, or manual, and it does not have to cover the entire broadcast b=
and. This is one method and device for providing the raw audio, and if you'=
re tesitng to see if it's just broadcast fragments, consider this-the conce=
pt is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker runs on a computer, the entities manip=
ulate that raw audio inside the conmputer, and if you think stray RF=C2=A0i=
s going to get inside the hard drive and mix with=C2=A0the audio file you h=
ave no clue how any technology works. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Testing is irrelavent!=
 It's not the device, it's the user. The messages received are for the user=
, and rarely does anyone hear the same thing as the original listener. 
=C2=
=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0You test it by use, you judge it by what comes through and=
 what it means to you, you can't play the sound snipets to a panel of numbn=
uts(objective listeners)) and expect to get an unbiased/honest test. No two=
 people hear the same, so an "objective listener" is an insult to most peop=
le doing this work.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I know, I'm being harsh.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Fra=
nk-S


On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 8:20 AM, rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote=
:


=C2=A0 




Hey all, I've seen lots of people posting their perspective=
s and results and such about the Frank's Box. In order to help develop some=
 good testing for it, I think the first step is to get a common or official=
 consensus or statement on what it is the Frank's Box is claiming to be doi=
ng. This might seem a silly question, but I think it's important to make su=
re any testing doesn't go off in some irrevelevant direction.


Frank - or =
anyone - what is a good official statement on what the Frank's box can do?
=

<div> It's a freaking radio!  The tuning is swept =
across the entire band, AM or FM, the resulting bits of speech, music, and =
noise are used by the enitites as a raw material to build their voices from=
. The sweep can be linear, random, or manual, and it does not have to cover=
 the entire broadcast band. This is one method and device for providing the=
 raw audio, and if you're tesitng to see if it's just broadcast fragments, =
consider this-the concept is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker runs on a compu=
ter, the entities manipulate that raw audio <u>inside</u> the conmputer, an=
d if you think stray RF is going to get <u>inside</u> the hard drive a=
nd mix with the audio file you have no clue how any technology works. =
</div>

<div> </div>
<div> Testing is irrelavent! It's not the de=
vice, it's the user. The messages received are for the user, and rarely doe=
s anyone hear the same thing as the original listener. </div>
<div> </=
div>
<div> </div>
<div> You test it by use, you judge it by what =
comes through and what it means to you, you can't play the sound snipets to=
 a panel of numbnuts(objective listeners)) and expect to get an unbiased/ho=
nest test. No two people hear the same, so an "objective listener" is an in=
sult to most people doing this work.</div>

<div> </div>
<div> I =
know, I'm being harsh.</div>
<div> </div>
<div> Frank-S<br><br></=
